Posts.Title: Cervical Cancer

Posts.Content: I'm also confused. Her dx and treatments seem to be moving very very fast. Has she had a second opinion? Did they check her lymph nodes? I'm surprised that the are doing chemo and then surgery, I thought they did either or first not together. I hope all goes well for your girlfriend. Could your girlfriend not use your computer/access to post?
Posts.Title: infilterating ductal carcinoma?

Posts.Content: Hi, I was on Tamoxifen for 1 yr. My side effects were back pain and blurred vision, I told my onco that I didn't want to take it any more, I told her that I was stopping taking it and she immediately put me on Arimidex, on this over 6 mths now and no real side effects to report so far. Please, if you are in doubt of using Tamoxifen, then don't take it, there are a lot of drugs out there, you just have to persist with your doctor. Take care
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen is not the only cancer fighting drug

Posts.Content: Hi, I would like for you to inform the public that you DO NOT need to have a lump to have Breast Cancer and that the only way to really be sure your ok from year to year is to have a mamogram
Posts.Title: Story

Posts.Content: Hi, I was on Tamoxifen for over a year and was having terrible aches/pains in my back, legs and feet. I did a test myself and stopped taking it and the pain went away immediately and when I started back on it the pain started again. I told my onco and she put me on Arimdex, now I'm suffering with really bad skin/pimples and I'm 38... so I did the same sort of test and had the same result, but I'd rather pimples than back/leg and foot pain. Do a test it should only take about 2 weeks. I hope this helps..... best wishes.
Posts.Title: Achy

Posts.Content: Hi, I was with my oncologist last night, she is strongly recommending a Colonoscopy - because young women that have BC (I'm 35) are at high risk for colon cancer. I am Stage IIb, estrogen + and Her2/neu +. Was anyone else told this? Thanks in advance.
